title: Reflection - mirror and ray originating from C

content.question: A plane mirror is located near a set of labeled points, as shown in the figure. A light ray originating from Point <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math> is incident somewhere on the surface of the mirror. What location(s) along the top edge of the grid in the figure could be reached by the light ray that is reflected from the mirror?

choices.label: Any location between points <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and <math alttext="E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">E</mi></math>

Any location between points <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> and <math alttext="D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">D</mi></math> only
At Point <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math> only

At points <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> or <math alttext="E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">E</mi></math> only

content.answer: Any location between points <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and <math alttext="E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">E</mi></math>
